text.section:
Unless a license is renewed for a 2-year term as provided in this section, the license expires on the first April 30 that comes:
after the effective date of the license; and
in an even-numbered year.

At least 1 month before a license expires, the Secretary shall mail to the licensee, at the last known address of the licensee:
a renewal application form; and
a notice that states:
the date on which the current license expires;
the date by which the Secretary must receive the renewal application for the renewal to be issued and mailed before the license expires; and
the amount of the renewal fee.
The Secretary may require a licensee to submit a national and State criminal history records check with the renewal application.
The Secretary shall renew the license of each licensee who meets the requirements of this section.
A license is not transferable and may be used only to benefit the licensee.

section.section:
A licensee may change the place of business for which a license is issued only if the licensee:
submits to the Secretary an application to transfer the license to a new business location on a form that the Secretary provides; and
receives the written approval of the Secretary.
Within 45 days after the application is filed with the Secretary, the Secretary shall approve or disapprove the application and notify the licensee of the approval or disapproval, in writing.

If the Secretary approves a proposed change of place of business, the licensee shall:
submit to the Secretary a current list of names of each employee to be employed at the new location; and
attach the written approval of the Secretary to the license until an amended license is received by the licensee.

text.section: The Secretary may determine that licenses issued under this subtitle shall expire on a staggered basis.
